review: I'm not that hot on this device.I waited for the 1080p version to come out, and bought when it did.Pros:====Really good picture qualityElegant device - no external power supply, UI is nice to look atWorks well with iTunes on a host PCAirplay from an iPad is kinda neatCons:====Doesn't do much - no prime streaming, no Vudu, for example.  We hardly use it - preferring the Netflix UI on the TV in one room, and a Roku due to more streaming options available in the other room.Remote is almost useless - I use an iPad most of the timeIt had a network issue (I used hard-wired) - which was finally solved by a software update ... that required wireless networking!  Set it up temporarily and it's been fine sinceCan't do much configuring - can't even delete icons for things you don't want to have appear, though you can move them to a lower rowI like the headphone jack on Roku 2 and 3 - nice feature this misses.  I'd imagine it could be done via streaming the sound to an iPadAlso, I'm surprised there's no app store for these, or games using an tablet or phone as controller.Steve

review: First I must admit that I support apple products fully and because I do my products work together better than most. We have 3 Mac computers, an apple extreme, 2 iPods, iPads and only iPhones, there is no droid products and the only Microsoft product is loaded on a Mac computer. This Apple TV works flawlessly with the other products and streams more beautifully than our hd cable does. There are limitations though. We purchase music and video from amazon as well as having a prime membership that forces us to watch prime video through another resource (ps3) while we were once able to stream through airplay there have been limitations created that unable both audio and video to seamlessly stream in unison. There has been additions made to the channels that are very helpful. HBO and espn to go are great additions that expand viewing options exponentially and also alleviate DVR needs for me. I would give 5 stars if amazon purchased products worked just as iTunes products do, but unfortunately they do not.
